intro: Bourreria angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf burrhead, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along stream banks. Bourreria angustifolia is also known for its ability to produce fibrous seed pods that can persist on the plant for extended periods.
